text: Emma Mary Tiglao (born December 8, 1994) is a Filipino model and beauty pageant titleholder who won as Binibining Pilipinas Intercontinental 2019. She represented the Philippines at the Miss Intercontinental 2019 pageant and placed in the Top 20. == Life == Tiglao was born on December 8, 1994 at Mabalacat, Pampanga. She studied tourism at Holy Angel University. == Pageantry == === Mutya ng Pilipinas 2012 === Tiglao first competed at Mutya ng Pilipinas 2012. She secured the first runner-up spot. === Binibining Pilipinas 2014 === Tiglao later signed to compete at Binibining Pilipinas 2014 to win a crown. She entered the Top 25, then ended up as a Top 15 finalist to Mary Jean Lastimosa. === Miss World Philippines 2015 === Tiglao's third national pageant was Miss World Philippines 2015. She was the fourth runner-up. She took a break from pageantry and served as a judge of Miss Cambodia 2016 and went to Malaysia and Cambodia to work as a model. === Binibining Pilipinas 2019 === Tiglao made her comeback to pageantry as she competed at Binibining Pilipinas on her second attempt. She competed on June 9, 2019 at the Smart Araneta Coliseum. Tiglao won two special awards during the ceremony; Best In National Costume and Miss Pizza Hut. She won Binibining Pilipinas Intercontinental 2019 and was crowned by the outgoing Binibining Pilipinas Intercontinental 2018, Karen Gallman, who is also Miss Intercontinental 2018 from the Philippines. === Miss Intercontinental 2019 === She represented the Philippines at the Miss Intercontinental 2019 competition on December 20, 2019 at Egypt and placed in the Top 20 finalist. ==Filmography== ===Television=== {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" !
